newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Jan 20.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Jan 20.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
Westpac holds its annual meeting at 2.00 p.m. (0300 GMT) on Monday and is expected to comment on its profit outlook.

AWA Ltd has said it is interested in acquiring A$140 million poker machine maker Olympic, The Australian Financial Review said. AWA chief executive John Rouse told the paper AWA was interested in buying Olympic, Australia's second largest poker machine maker behind Aristocrat Leisure Ltd.

Reef Casino Trust said the board of Reef Corporate Services Ltd, the trust's manager, unanimously agreed on Friday with the trust founders and the hotel and casino lessees on a process to seek additional capital for the trust and a timetable for implementation. An application to lift the suspension of the trust's units would be made this week after completion of formal documentation.

Placer Dome Inc said late on Friday it would extend its A$0.75 a share takeover offer for Highlands Gold Ltd for one week to January 25 and that it currently held over 58 percent of Highlands shares. Earlier, Highlands said that it had an offer from Papua New Guinea institutions to invest and underwrite for a share issue to raise A$110 million which would allow a restructuring of the company.

Central Norseman Gold Corp said on Friday it produced 36,323 ounces of gold in the December quarter, up 7,074 ounces on the previous quarter, when a series of planned mill shutdowns restricted mining.
